They perform user research, solve diverse problems, navigate the unknown, and work with the team to ideate, test, and deliver high-value solutions to customers.Ideal Candidate Has Experience In‍Discovery Continuous Discovery Problem Framing Customer Interviews - Problem Interviews, Solution Interviews Usability Testing Willingness to Pay Testing Design Sprints Product Analytics Risk Prioritization ‍Discovery Artifacts: Opportunity Solution Trees Customer Journey Maps Empathy Maps, Personas Use Cases User Story Maps Service Blueprints ‍Visual Design Conceptualizing Moodboarding Information Architecture Interaction Design Design Systems Design Tokens Rapid Prototyping, Functional Clickables High Fidelity Design ‍Delivery Experiment Design Analysis QA Testing ‍Bonus:Brand Design‍Expectations for your first 90 days: Develops a solid grasp of our product lines, feature sets, value proposition, business model, pricing, product development process, and documents this for the benefit of future product team members. Updates training material and onboarding process for future new hires by shadowing current team members Becomes an authority on product area & contributes Designs for current quarter Explores and prototypes 5 solutions to team objective New designs are tested with customers Presents 3 solution designs to product leadership Delivers 2 approved solutions in collaboration with engineering team and gathers feedback from 3-5 customers Leads Design for an objective ‍Perks: Monthly Friday Free Day Company Holidays Paid Time Off (in addition to the above) Monthly Healthcare Allowance Yearly Vacation Allowance Fun and busy work environment with smart, caring people Location independence Mission driven company and values-based culture Please only apply if you: Embrace learning new technology Learn fast Communicate crisply Proactively seek solutions Own the outcome Bring an optimistic “can do” attitude Supply your own internet and smartphone Bachelors Degree (preferred) Have B2B SaaS experience (preferred) 3 years demonstrated success in similar role ‍***NOTE: Hiring within the US (except CO, CA, NY) and in Central and South America***‍We have an amazing team of A-Players and we’re ready to add more! Selected candidates might have written assessments and multiple interviews with different people. We’ll do whatever it takes to get the right person in the right seat.‍If you think you would thrive in the above environment and make an impact for our customers, we’d love to talk to you!‍In summary...‍You can do it in an officeYou can do it from homeWe really don’t careAs long as it’s known 👇‍What matters is this…When the chips are downAnd your back is against the wallCan we count on you to make the right call?‍Judgment, intuition, or care by another nameWe call it “Owning The Outcome” - because it really is the whole gameHave the customers back, and they will treat you the same‍If you can do thatThen we’re birds of the same featherSo come join our team and we’ll make music together.

title: UI / UX Designer & Gaming Enthusiast
description: 🐬 Fluyo is a startup looking for a legendary UX designer who will transform our well designed & fun language learning app into an incredibly well designed & even more fun app! Someone who through data/research, good intuition and design taste will level up our product user’s experience to the maximum level.Our mission at Fluyo is to make the world speak another language by making language learning truly fun. We combine the most effective language education with all the fun of a video game.🧑‍🏫 Industry: Language Learning🧑‍💻 Seniority: Mid/Senior (you will be the primary UX/UI designer in our team)🏢 Company Size: 5 to 10 employees💰 Salary: €40k-55k EUR / $45k-60k USD per year📈 Equity: 0.1 - 0.25%Perks-⏱ Flexible working hours (work whenever you want, but be available to chat during core hours: 8-11am EST / 2-5pm CET)- 🌍 100% Remote working (our team is based in 7 different countries worldwide)- 💰 Funded on Kickstarter (highest funded app in Kickstarter history!)- 🚀 Make a real difference (we are publicly launching in several months, so this is a really exciting time to join!)- 🏖️ Unlimited vacation time: You are in charge of deciding when to work.- 🐣 Be an early team member + equity (as the company grows, your role will grow, and so will all the rewards!)- 😎 A chilled out team (we work hard, but we do not micromanage at all)Essential Skills Required 3+ years of UX experience, high level proficiency with Adobe XD / Figma, and an elegant & modern portfolio Experience in game design or extensive gaming experience (the majority of Fluyo is either a game or very gamified, we need someone who is familiar with common gaming mechanics) Your files, components, prototypes and designs are highly organized You love learning new languages and have used various language learning apps You love talking to customers/users to get product feedback and can turn this feedback into designs You possess a strong intuition for what you believe users would like based on your own experience (not solely relying on research & data) You absolutely love UX, and constantly think about how your designs will affect user happiness and success You enjoy working closely with developers to ensure your designs are implemented correctly The RoleYou will be the main product designer in the team, and will be responsible for taking our current (slightly messy) XD file and transforming it into a professional, modern UI kit & design. You will then be responsible for collecting and analyzing user feedback from our app, to determine what features users want added or improved, and then you will determine their feasibility and turn them into prototypes (and then full designs).You will be responsible for anything that users interact with (and how they exactly interact with) on the app. We want someone who is bright, hard working and has a great user experience and visual design taste. We want someone who can take charge over our product and envision all the potential ways our product’s user experience can be improved, design said improvements and work with our developers to ensure your designs are matched and do QA. Please add the word “Goldshire” to your application so we know you read this post completely. Ultimately, the goal of this role is to help make our app an absolute joy for our customers to use.Essentially, we need someone who is a professional and talented designer, but also someone who cares deeply about products and customers, and is always thinking about how to make our product more useful/enjoyable.This is a full time requirement (approx. 7 hours per day) for 1 designer. Please no agencies. We want someone who can commit to our team and focus exclusively on this. We are not looking for a freelancer who has multiple projects on at the same time.Our CompanyWere a language learning app that will completely change the way people learn languages. Were making a language learning app that is truly fun and addictive. It’s not simply “a gamified app”, it’s an actual game. A game that has been designed from the ground up to also be the most effective language learning system that’s ever existed. Other apps can be effective, but often are not truly fun and are very difficult to use consistently. Hence users rely on forcing themselves to use them.In contrast, our app inspires excitement, acts as a platform for learners to make friends, is extremely fun, easy to use consistently and therefore makes one’s language learning journey so much better. We just became the most funded app on Kickstarter ever, and you can see our campaign and learn more about our product here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/550782470/fluyoInterview Process Application form (below) We review your portfolio, if we think you are potential fit, we’ll send you a small paid design / user flow critique test Video call with CTO & CEO Thanks so much for checking out our job! We cant wait to read your application and (hopefully) welcome you to our team! Even if this job is not a good fit for you, we will keep your contact details and email you about future jobs that fit your profile. We are going to be hiring a lot in 2023!

title: Senior Designer
description: Stacvalley, Germanys leading marketing agency for Amazon sellers, is on the lookout for a talented and experienced Senior Designer to join our dynamic and creative team. While our headquarters are in Germany, this specific role is open to candidates interested in working remotely.As a Senior Designer at Stacvalley, youll be responsible for designing and creating high-quality product images. Your creative abilities will play a pivotal role in narrating the story of each product and enticing buyers to press the purchase button.Responsibilities: Designing and creating appealing product images that highlight the USPs and foster buyer engagement. Collaborating with the marketing and product team to bolster the visual communication and brand identity of our clients on Amazon. Continuously updating and adapting to the latest design trends and best practices in the e-commerce industry. Adhering to project timelines and ensuring compliance with quality standards across all design projects. Qualifications: A minimum of three years of experience in a similar role, ideally in an agency specializing in Amazon or other e-commerce platforms. An impressive portfolio that showcases your ability to develop and implement creative concepts. Expert knowledge in common design software tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, etc. Strong organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Excellent communication skills and the ability to accept and implement constructive feedback. If youre passionate about delivering groundbreaking creative work and want to write the next chapter of your career in one of Germanys most successful agencies, we look forward to your application. Your creative abilities have the potential to create a ripple in the Amazon marketplace, and we cant wait to achieve that with you.

title: Graphic Designer
description: Please make sure to submit your professional portfolio in English while applying! 💸 25k – 35k USD per year, full time contractor contract🌎 Fully remote working from anywhere in Mexico!✨ Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment💻 Working with the latest hardware, tech stack and tools🏋️‍♀️ Access to benefits (country dependent 🌎)ABOUT STORM IDEASFounded in 2008, we are an international team that works with incredible and globally-recognised clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en-masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.Currently, we are a growing team of 175+ people, but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!RESPONSIBILITIESWhat can you expect? Reviewing never-before-seen TV episodes before they’re released Using Figma and Adobe Creative Suite to produce high-quality social content for high profile US TV clients Using existing branding guidelines and source material to create fun social media assets to engage fans and promote US TV shows Suggesting a variety of creative solutions and providing options for managers and clients to consider Following client accounts and competitors on social media to research and put forward own ideas for engaging and innovative content Producing assets that convey a clear and effective message with impact and creative flair that encourage click through or engagement Managing time well to produce multiple assets per day and communicate with managers on progress Learning our collaborative tools and using them to drive your assets through our internal processes Self-evaluating, proofing and reviewing own work Incorporating internal and client feedback into final product Developing your own skills by learning from other team members and through independent research QUALIFICATIONSWhats important to us: Excellent eye for detail particularly in regards to typography and layout Advanced understanding of Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop and Illustrator Experience and skills in illustratiodigital artwork Experience with producing fun, polished, well-designed assets Ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines while maintaining accuracy Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities High work-ethic and self-motivation YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT Modern Tech StackWe use the latest tools, hardware and methodologies across our teams. We’re always on the look-out for new ways of working and ensure everyone is setup with enough hardware firepower to excel, Windows or Mac.Agility & Openness for IdeasWe actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here! Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.Outstanding PeopleWe believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality and skills, we’re an international team with more than 175 people onboard and we’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!FlexibilityJoining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.PAYMENT25,000 – 35,000 USD per year, depending on experience and skills.CONTRACT TYPEFull time contractor contract - fully remote working from anywhere in Mexico!RECRUITMENT PROCESSFirstly, we will invite you to a first interview - Here you will meet Jakub, our Design Manager, in a 60 minute interview via Zoom. It’s a mix of technical and culture-fit questions as well as providing you with more details about our projects and working in our team. If the technical interview with Jakub goes well, we will invite you to complete a design task followed by the final interview (30 minutes) which is a mix of technical and culture-fit questions.And that’s it!

title: Freelance Book Designer 📚 🎨
description: Please go to this page to create and submit your profile: https://reedsy.com/join-our-community.RoleWe are seeking talented book designers and illustrators to join our fast-growing community of top talent in publishing. Reedsys vetted group of freelancers have worked on a range of widely acclaimed novels, such as The Hunger Games, Originals (Adam Grant), and His Dark Materials series (Phillip Pullman).There are hundreds of authors currently looking for designers and illustrators on Reedsy. Reedsy allows you to pick which genres youd like to work on so you only receive projects in your area of interest. You will work where and when you want, and set your own rates.The minimum requirements we look for are: Full-time professional experience in design. Minimum 3 years of experience. Demonstrated experience on at least 5 published and well-reviewed books (available on Amazon, Google Play or Apple Books). A history of high-quality work with a bestselling author or on a bestselling book will be positively valued, as well as experience with a renowned publishing company.If you are curious, here is a look at some recent cover art by Reedsy professionals: https://blog.reedsy.com/book-cover-art/.About usReedsy is a community of over 1,000,000 authors and freelance publishing professionals, creating high-quality and beautiful books. We help authors to find and work with the top professionals in the industry: from editors to designers, marketers, and translators.### How to applyTo apply, please create and submit a profile on our website through the Get started button. We recommend that you follow the 7 tips on this article to create a great profile that portrays you and your work in its best light. Good luck!---Not sure whether you have the necessary experience? This quick quiz will let you know whether your application is likely to get accepted.

title: Freelance Book Designer/ Illustrator
description: We are seeking a talented book designer/ illustrator to join our fast-growing community of the industrys top publishing professionals. Reedsys freelancers have worked on a range of widely acclaimed novels such as The Hunger Games, Originals (Adam grant), and His Dark Materials (Phillip Pullman) series.There are hundreds of authors currently looking for an illustrator on Reedsy. Reedsy allows you to pick which types of design youd like to do, so you only receive projects in your area of interest. Here is a look at our current trends: https://blog.reedsy.com/book-cover-art/Requirements- Have 3+ years of experience in illustration.- Produced art for at least five published books or high-level publications (Optional)

title: Motion Graphics / Animator
description: Were looking for a full time Animator with 4+ years of experience in After Effects and other Adobe Creative Suite products, C4D, Unreal and model rigging is a plus but not required. Position is remote, but travel to various locations to instal productions is often required. Send Resume, Work Samples and Resume to info@rhynecreative.com. US Work visa required.

title: Principal Product Designer (Contract)
description: OverviewThoughtful AI seeks an experienced and ambitious Product Designer. We are looking for a talented individual with a proven track record of designing exceptional product experiences for B2B customers. Responsibilities: Deliver aesthetically engaging interfaces that captivate and delight users. Take ownership of UI and interaction design, tackling difficult challenges with bold and holistic design solutions that elevate the experience of working with our AI-powered products. Embrace first principles thinking and reimagine user interactions with AI-powered products and data. Collaborate with engineers and product managers to define both long-term strategies and short-term tactics for our products. Adapt to both broadly defined, open-ended concepts and narrowly defined, tactical deliverables. Foster a highly collaborative environment by working closely with product and project teams. You may be a good fit for this role if you: Enjoy collaborating with a tight-knit team to explore, design, ship, and iterate on products. Feel comfortable working directly with founders in an agile format, testing and iterating to meet business needs. Can distill complex problems into flexible, powerful, and user-friendly solutions. Are an avid learner who values feedback and data to inform design decisions. Get excited about exploring new ways for customers to interact with unique datasets. Excel at explaining your work, process, and decisions to cross-functional stakeholders and actively seek feedback to produce your best work. Pay meticulous attention to details, striving for pixel-perfect experiences while maintaining speed. Think in systems and can extend and extrapolate shared patterns and behaviors. Have at least 5 years of relevant design experience at a high-growth, tech-focused, product-driven company. If you possess some or all of the following qualifications, please apply: Strong design portfolio showcasing your depth of interface design skills. Naturally curious and driven to push the boundaries of whats possible. Take pride in your work, demonstrating ownership and consistently delivering high-quality results. Methodical approach with strong attention to detail. Self-directed and decisive, taking initiative to drive action. Continuously improving and open to feedback through collaboration. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, particularly in remote team environments. Experience working with leaders, presenting and defending your design decisions. Previous experience leading the end-to-end design process. Please include the following in your application: A link to your online portfolio. Your LinkedIn profile. A brief statement explaining why Thoughtful AI is of interest to you and why you’d be a perfect fit.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Who we are:Axion’s mission is to create the world’s best automotive and aerospace engineering management analytics platform, powered by machine learning. We’re revolutionizing the way next-gen vehicles are made and have partnered with forward-looking engineering leaders to deploy machine learning models that will accelerate our speed to an electric, connected, supersonic future. Our team includes experts in Machine Learning, Enterprise AI, and SaaS from GoogleX, Spotify, Microsoft, Palantir, McKinsey & QuantumBlack, and other top tech companies. Since our founding at the onset of 2021, we’ve deployed across some of the largest Automotive and Aerospace companies in the world. If you want the chance to help build the future of engineering leadership, join us.Why Us:Join a fast-growing, early-stage startup with the chance to make a significant impact from day one. Our culture puts people first. We will encourage you to bring your full self to work and will set you up to succeed.You’ll also get: Highly competitive compensation Meaningful equity Leadership opportunity in a high-growth company A great team. We bring a unique combination of technical and business skills, with company leaders from top tech companies like Spotify, business leadership from McKinsey, and automotive leadership from GM and Ford. We’re an interdisciplinary team that prizes collaboration & diversity of thinking. Where you’ll be:Prefer an office to work? We have options for your working preferences. Prefer to work from home? You can Work From Anywhere at Axion.We are looking for a Product Designer who will: Strategise, sketch and design new products and features for a diverse set of users Translate user requirements and your own research into tangible design concepts to bring a product concept to life quickly Help run short design sprints and work in a fast-moving, agile environment Be able to conduct your own user research as well as building and testing prototypes Feel equally comfortable sketching and wireframing a design solution as you are making UI and data visualisations look beautiful and compelling Ideally help build out a design system and help develop patterns and components for re-use with our engineering teams Your expertise: 5 years’ experience designing user-centred products and enterprise applications, ideally with experience visualising data An awe-inspiring portfolio and a design process that you can articulate clearly Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain the rationale behind your design concepts Experience with agile methodologies and integrating design with cross-functional delivery teams An obsessive attention-to-detail in everything you do, from storytelling and clarity of communication through to detailed wireframes and UI designs Experience working with data science teams in an enterprise environment would be a huge advantage. Knowledge and experience using tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite Come work with us, were growing!

title: Senior Designer
description: Job: Resign Internal Tools + Build Upcoming Website DesignsLocation: Remote.Who we are: Were a record label based in Cluj, Romania. Website: 11x11.ioWhat we need:Recently, weve created a lot of tools and dashboards using PowerBi and Airtable. However, the designs are all over the place and we need someone to help us connect everything and make it look good.We need help with redesigning all of our dashboards and connecting them together. These dashboards are related to accounting, music production, contracts, artist royalties, catalogue management, and analytics. We want all of these dashboards to be password-protected and available on our website.We also need help with designing a music storage and sharing app, similar to Dropbox and SoundCloud. We want it to be easy to use and have all the features we need.Lastly, we need a website design that displays our original songs catalog, which will act as a marketplace for smaller independent filmmakers and TV advertising teams to find songs that fit a specific vibe or sound.

title: Product Designer
description: About The Role:At Montra, we’re working to create a magical video creation experience; in doing so, design is at the centre of who we are. As our first product design hire, youll work closely with our CEO to wireframe, design and ultimately shape the user experience and interface beyond our initial MVP. You’ll have the autonomy to take risks and challenge the norms well beyond your typical video editor.What You’ll Do: Work closely with our CEO to build upon our existing distinct product and brand guidelines Own the design process from start to finish, including wire-framing, prototyping, and developer walk-through Frequently iterate on designs based on internal and external feedback Simplify complex design problems into beautiful user experiences Who You Are:Must Have 2-5 yrs of UI/UX design experience Proficient in working collaboratively in Figma Obsessed with crafting simple and gorgeous user experiences A robust portfolio of past work/projects demonstrating your ascetic and abilities to simplify complex problems Excellent verbal and written communication skills Great To Have Deep interest in the future of video as a communication method and how we’ll build products that shape that future Self-motivated person who can work individually and as part of a team Experience in working in remote and in person teams Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment How to Apply:At Montra, we believe the best team members come from diverse backgrounds and bring unique experiences to work. We don’t care where you came from, where you went to school, or what you do. We simply care about your grit, work ethic, and passion for video as a mechanism for sharing ideas. While the makeup of our team is not all one and the same, we are all bonded by our belief that a world where more people can create videos they’re proud of is a world we all want to live in. If that sounds like a world you want to help create, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Skydio is the leading US drone manufacturer and world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial transportation. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, and operational excellence to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users - from action sports enthusiasts to first responders.About the role: As a Senior Product Designer you will research, prototype, design and ship web and mobile applications that unlock Skydio hardware’s potential across a wide array of inspection, industrial, construction, public safety and defense use cases. You will work directly with the Sr. Director of Product Design, Designers, Product Managers, and Engineers to understand our customers most pressing needs and build incredible cross-platform experiences:How youll make an impact: Design core and new functionality for Skydio Cloud. These include: Media Management Fleet Management Inspection & Mapping Data Visualization Annotation and Records Tools Remote Operation Go on-site with customers to deeply understand their needs, use cases and work with Product Managers and Engineers to build incredible new AI based tools that customers love Work with other designers, engineers and marketers to build out the Skydio Design Language across our Cloud, Mobile, and Marketing experiences. Discover, design and document new components, modules, visual styles and treatments that will create a toolbox for ALL designers to build more efficiently and cohesively Provide mockups, user flows, pixel-perfect designs in Figma, or write HTML/CSS directly to drive the design process for engineers, while communicating design goals to PMs and Executives Bring your insights and experience to improve production and processes around the design org What makes you a good fit: Proven track record of delivering effective design to consumer and/or enterprise customers A portfolio that clearly defines your contributions shipping cloud products in multiple disciplines within design including: Photo management Data or Fleet Management Geospatial Analysis or Mapping 3D Web Tools Video Review Workflows Remote Hardware Sensing (cameras, robotics, aviation) Solid understanding of design systems that span mobile, web and marketing Strong examples of beautiful data, visualization, 3d, and table layout and visual design Bonus Experience: Familiarity with 3D for Web (WebGL, Cesium, ThreeJS) Some front-end coding ability in HTML/CSS/Javascript Familiarity with Front-end design libraries like Ant, Bootstrap, Tailwind CSS. Familiarity with 3D Animation tools like Cinema4D, Blender, Maya and After Effects

title: A Designer Thats Work Shows They Care
description: What We Are Looking For:We are looking for a designer, artist, and creative that DEEPLY CARES about creating magical products. We are looking for someone who wants to create a brand and experience that they view as a masterpiece they are proud of for decades to come.30,000 Foot View On Air:At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer’s faces to light up. We are currently working on a suite of products that help businesses scale rapidly… from a fintech platform that facilitates high ticket purchases, to a conversational AI that can have full-blown 25 minute sales calls and is indistinguishable from a human. Because of our customers love for our products, we’ve generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching Air 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).Comp:Salary: $120k-$250k a yearOwnership: 0-1% equityThe Most Important Question: Why Air?You are on a floating rock in the middle of the universe. Let that sink in.The truth is… you do not need another “job.” — if that is what you are looking for, you can save your time and just stop reading now.What you need is to be a part of something that matters — to be a part of something that causes you to tap dance into work everyday.At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer’s faces to light up.After all, that is the real goal of building software… not to generate ARR, not to prop up your valuation, not to raise more capital… but to create products you are proud to stamp your name on and to create products that are a part of your life story.And the fascinating dichotomy that our team at Air believes in strongly is that a team obsessed with creating great products always has more success than a team focused primarily on making money.At Air, our focus on product is why we have generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).We aren’t building Air to sell in the next few years or to add some zero’s to our net worth. We want to build a company that lives long past any of our founders. A company that maintains an essence of excellence over the long term. A company that people can feel is synonymous with quality.We are looking for more A players to join our team that meet these 3 criteria:1. Someone Willing To Work Obsessively On Something They Truly Believe In (An Obsessive... They Think About “Air” All The Time)2. Someone With Years Of Evidence Of Exceptional Ability At Their Craft (And Learns Rapidly)3. Someone Who Is “One Of Us” - The Thought Of Working With Them Everyday Excites Us (Businesses Are At Their Best When Everyone Enjoys Who They Are Going To War With Everyday)What would I be working on at Air?We have multiple areas a designer and creative could step in and have an immediate impact on our customer experience and brand as a whole: UI & UX: Helping create a unified experience across our suite of products. We want people to see our products and at a glance say Oh, that must have been built by Air Logos: We have multiple new products in development that will need on brand logos Website: Our current website is meh - We have a strong vision for how we could better convey what we are building and what we stand for Next steps?If you want to learn more about our vision and are curious about what we are building at Air and how you could contribute, apply belowCaleb Maddix, Co-Founder Of Air.ai

title: Senior Product Designer
description: As a Senior Product Designer, you will have significant ownership of design objectives and strategy. This role will be responsible for discovering opportunities for product excellence and differentiation on our products. Combining an understanding of business opportunities with a deep empathy for the user, you’ll work on creating experiences that help customers invest in alternatives to improve their overall wealth. You’ll collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to determine strategy, roadmaps and deliverables while also maintaining a lot of autonomy over your work.What youll do:Product Strategy Conceptualize and design for web (including mobile) and print Contribute at a high level for design strategy and communicate the vision, roadmap, and goals for a business Define short- and long-term design opportunities for the product. Collaborate closely with Product Management, Engineering, Analytics and Business Development to define product solutions as well as business efficiencies Partner with Product Managers to develop the strategy and rationale for product solutions Partner closely with Engineering to ensure our implementation and user experience is of high-quality Prioritize internal, cross-functional, and external design resource(s). Create and iterate on solutions that are inspired by a deep empathy for our users Identify key opportunities to meet and prioritize user and business needs Use research and data to inform and implement solutions Ideate new product features and improvements. Work collaboratively to prioritize feature ideas. Flesh out feature concepts. UX Design Develop strategic insights and strategies to guide UX development Create high level user flows for complex products. Design processes, features, and components that can be used Understand business and technical needs Works cross-functionally (in and outside of the product team) to create innovative features. UI Design Design processes, features, and components that can be used across products Create UI components for product flows. Contribute components to the Alto design system. Work collaboratively with Engineering to ensure finished product meets design specifications. Work in close collaboration with Design Leadership to grow the team as well as to inform and improve design processes What wed like to see on your resume: 6+ years professional experience, specifically as a Product Designer designing web-based products, with experience with UX and UI. Bachelors degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience. Experience leading and launching end-to-end product / product features Design Portfolio demonstrating strong UX and visual design solutions, with an emphasis on identifying and meaningfully solving true user problems. Exceptional track record executing on product design strategy, mentoring designers, and partnering with cross functional team members. Experience building world class product experiences, and streamlining workflows with continuous iteration and improvement. What you bring to the table: High proficiency in Figma Familiarity with other UX/UI software for creating flows, prototypes Ability to analyze and use data and research to inform decisions Utilize understanding and analysis of quantitative data, qualitative user understanding, and knowledge of business capabilities to develop features and product experiments Attention to detail Humble — Not driven by personal opinions Excellent verbal and communication skills Excellent analytical skills to break down and solve complex problems Proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally Design discovery (user research, competitive research) Deep user empathy around complex/emotional categories Foundational understanding of HTML and CSS. Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to lead user experience design, including usability principles, user research methodology, testing techniques (A/B, Multi-Variant), design theory, and interaction design. Willingness to roll up your sleeve and get things done. Take smart risks and champion new ideas. Passionate about contributing and maintaining design systems Skills such as illustration, animation, data visualization, front-end programming, or copywriting a plus

title: Design Lead
description: Brandbeet, a dynamic design agency that has partnered with renowned Fortune 500 companies and has a diverse portfolio spanning healthcare, tech, and ecommerce industries, is seeking a talented and versatile individual to join our team as a Design lead. This role offers flexibility in terms of hours, ranging from 10 to 40 hours per week, and will be tailored to fit the right persons skill set and availability.Responsibilities: Collaborate directly with clients, leading and guiding design projects from inception to completion. Provide mentorship and management to a team of designers, fostering their growth and ensuring consistent quality in their work. Combine a commercial mindset with artistic vision to deliver exceptional design solutions that align with clients objectives. Exhibit a top-tier visual sensibility and a dedication to continuous improvement in design work. Demonstrate technical proficiency in responsive web design concepts and software, especially Figma. Primarily focus on UX/UI design, while also having the ability to think holistically about brand systems and establish a design aesthetic from the ground up. Embrace an ambitious and entrepreneurial mindset, driving innovation and pushing boundaries within the design industry. Requirements: Extensive experience in design, preferably in a senior or lead role within an agency environment. Proven track record of successfully managing client relationships and overseeing projects from start to finish. Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to inspire and guide a team of designers. Well-developed commercial and artistic acumen, enabling the delivery of compelling and effective design solutions. Exceptional visual design skills and a keen eye for detail. Proficiency in responsive web design principles and tools, particularly Figma. Ability to think strategically and translate client objectives into cohesive design strategies. A portfolio showcasing a range of impressive design projects and evidence of creative thinking. Self-motivated, proactive, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders. If you are a passionate and talented designer looking to make a significant impact, while working with high-profile clients across diverse industries, Brandbeet is the perfect place for you. We offer a collaborative and supportive work environment that fosters growth, creativity, and innovation.To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you believe you would be an excellent fit to lead at Brandbeet.

title: Web Designer
description: Were looking for a Designer who will be working with MyZenTeam — a team engagement platform. You’ll be in charge of our website, supervise that our brand will be consistent on different platforms (newsletters, lead magnets, social media) and offer design solutions to improve the experience for our customers.About usThe Remote Company is a network of remote-first tech companies. Were united by our values and approach to doing business.Our team has been working remotely for the last 8 years. We are very proud of the culture we have built and strongly believe that diverse teams have more potential to build successful global products. Please check our values to see if we are a right place for you. Glassdoor reviews will give you an inside look at what its like to work at The Remote Company.In 2022, Vercom, a cloud communication platform, acquired our product MailerLite with its subsidiary products MailerSend and MailerCheck for $90 million. It allowed us to put more resources and effort into our new products Ycode, MyZenTeam and Partnero.What we expect from you 2+ years experience working as a web designer. Experience working with Figma or Sketch. Knowledge of front-end development languages such as HTML and CSS. Practical knowledge of color theory, grid layout, typography, and graphic design. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills in English. Attention to detail (when you apply, include the phrase love my job somewhere in your application). Open-mind with the ability to adapt and acquire technical knowledge quickly. Huge plus if you have experience in SaaS product design. Bonus skills You have experience using frameworks like Tailwind or Bootstrap. You have basic knowledge of Vue.js or Javascript in general. You have some copywriting experience. What we offerSalary: $50,000-$70,000 (gross)

title: Brand Designer
description: About Us At Airhouse we help high-growth ecommerce companies simplify one of the most complex functions in their business: operations. Airhouse automates dozens of workflows and integrations to help companies get their products from factory to front door. From inventory and order management to warehouse partner sourcing and vetting, order fulfillment, returns and beyond, Airhouse makes it so that teams dont need to build a massive in-house operations team or any custom tech to manage fulfillment. Airhouse was founded in 2018, launched publicly in 2020, and currently serves 100+ high-growth businesses that manufacture everything from apparel to furniture to food and beverages.Airhouse’s core industry, logistics, is not historically design-forward. But, our customers are often themselves very creative brand-builders. At Airhouse, brand is a strategic imperative: we aim to make a memorable splash in the industry and in the minds of our customers. In this role as Brand Designer, you will grow Airhouse’s core style in new and experimental directions and own Airhouse’s overall look and feel.The right candidate for this role will be a creative but grounded designer who is skilled at balancing the competing demands of projects where design is involved, e.g. designing for conversion and designing within technical constraints.This is a full-time remote role that reports directly to our Co-Founder. Eligible candidates must be based in the United States. You will join as a senior individual contributor, with budget to extend your impact via outsourced agencies and consultants.Responsibilities Own our visual brand and its evolution in tandem with our Co-Founder and act as its guardian across the organization and the internet; ensure we create a single, cohesive experience of Airhouse, in particular for customers, but also for current and prospective employees, partners and others Develop visual concepts and materials for lead generation campaigns (ads, landing pages, social media graphics, etc.) with a cohesive look and feel, working with the team to quickly develop and test different iterations Wireframe and design responsive webpages in Webflow for our marketing website, airhouse.io, with a mobile-first approach (bonus if you can implement pages in Webflow) Design templates and graphics for sales proposals, marketing guides, ebooks, blog posts, documentation, presentations and other materials Create illustrations and diagrams for documentation to explain complex features, benefits and workflows for Sales, Marketing and Customer Success use Work closely with our Product Designer to ensure a single look and feel extends across all Airhouse properties and collaborate on maintaining a single, dynamic shared design system in Figma Manage design-related contractors and agencies alongside functional project leads, art direct and QA external design work to ensure it matches our brand and is functional, ensure production timelines are met, and secure resources where there are gaps Proactively help monitor written style when designing different materials and loop in relevant team members for content writing/voice and tone support Skills and Experience 3-5+ years working in brand, communications or visual design Some non-agency/in house experience preferred Strong art direction experience; you should feel comfortable taking our existing style guide, creating assets consistent with it, and then extending it, especially as it relates to graphics and illustration Strong grasp of grid systems, typography, and underlying design layout/composition principles Power user of Figma and Adobe CC: you not only know how to use these tools, but also believe in creating scalable design systems and asset libraries so that you can design efficiently and quickly onboard other designers onto projects Strong experience with design principles for web, including mobile-first responsive design Prior experience working with engineers to give feedback on implementation to match mockups, or strong HTML/CSS skills and the ability to work in Webflow Bonus if you have experience with any of the following: motion graphics, 2D illustration, 3D illustration, photography, video Benefits and Perks Competitive salary and equity based on experience A remote-first work environment with a headquarters in downtown San Francisco Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, ancillary) Flexible time off policy that encourages you to take time off when you need it Optional all-team meetups A remote work stipend to create a productive work environment wherever you may be Paid parental leave and short-term and long-term disability insurance For consideration, please submit a portfolio demonstrating your ability to design across multiple standard business formats, with art direction examples.Equal Opportunity EmploymentAirhouse is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity of all kinds and believe it contributes to our success as we build a world-class company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, neurotype, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal or state law.

title: Web3 Product Designer
description: About FuelFuel is building a high-performance blockchain operating system that provides high throughput without sacrificing decentralization or security. Our project is a full-stack solution that lets anyone deploy a Fuel chain using any configuration they would like (Rollup on Ethereum, Sovereign chain, Appchain, etc.). Currently, our focus is to launch an Ethereum rollup to help scale Ethereum beyond its current capacity.What we need from youUntil now, our design efforts have been led by our head of product, but its time to separate the design into a dedicated role. As our first Product Designer, you will work closely with our head of product and a team of world-class engineers to build the best blockchain user experience the world has yet to see.You’ll get to:- Work on a team where you always feel like the dumbest person in the room- Build out totally new product experiences from scratch- Iterate rapidly with immediate user feedback- Being able to define a unique brand and style guide from scratchIf any of that sounds exciting to you, then we would love to talk to you!Areas of Responsibility Collaborate with the front-end team to deliver our block explorer Design a distinctive, world-class marketing website that amplifies our brand and sets Fuel apart from the competition Ensure the front-end team always have designs ready 3 weeks ahead of engineering sprints and are never blocked on design questions for longer than 24h Work with the front-end team to expand and maintain our design system → https://design.fuel.network/ Establish feedback systems that consistently gather user insights, helping the team prioritize and improve our wallet and block explorer Skills and Traits Intellectual honesty and flexibility – Open to new ideas and willing to change your mind when presented with new information. Empathy – Able to navigate complex social situations and derive user insights. Drive to ship – Motivated to see your designs come to life and used by actual users. Deep understanding of blockchain – Been in crypto for over 2 years out of personal curiosity and interest. Excellent design skills – A strong aesthetic sense and experience in developing and maintaining design systems from scratch. Creative problem-solving – Strong ability to develop innovative solutions to design problems, considering user needs, tech constraints, and business goals. Strong design process – Clearly articulated approach to designing products, with the ability to predict and mitigate potential pitfalls. Required Experience At least 5 years of experience as a product designer working on products with actual user feedback (Agency and consultant experience does not count) Developed and maintained design systems from scratch Have built your own applications using frameworks like React/Vue Have been a user of crypto for +2 years and understand the UX problems that litter the space

title: Marketing Designer
description: Company OverviewWe are an FP&A software company that specializes in providing budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting solutions to small and medium-sized businesses. Our mission is to help businesses optimize financial performance through data analysis and strategic insights.We foster an inclusive and innovative culture, where team members take ownership, collaborate, drive impactful solutions, and celebrate wins.Job SummaryWe are looking for a talented marketing designer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of visual design principles and be able to translate marketing strategies into thoughtful solutions that help prospective customers understand how Basis can impact their business.You will be responsible for creating a wide range of marketing materials, including website designs, presentation decks, product screenshots and graphics, email assets, PDFs and display ads.Responsibilities Design and develop website layouts and graphics Produce sales enablement collateral such as presentation decks Produce graphics for blogs, webinars, and social media Design email campaigns and newsletters Use pre-existing brand guidelines and evolve them for new use cases Stay up-to-date on the latest design trends and technologies Qualifications Bachelors degree in graphic design or equivalent work experience 3+ years of experience in marketing design Must have prior website design experience and can provide links to past work Strong understanding of visual design principles Ability to work independently and as part of a team Proficiency in Figma or Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) Familiarity with HTML and CSS Experience with Webflow a huge plus Benefits Competitive salary and benefits package Opportunity to work with a talented and dedicated team Chance to make a real impact on the growth of a young company If you’re a talented designer with an eye-catching portfolio, we’d like to hear from you!

title: Product Designer
description: Who We AreNess is an early-stage, remote-first startup at the unique intersection of fintech and healthcare. We’re on a mission to build a world where everyone can afford to get and stay healthy.We’re fresh off a $15.5M seed round and funded by some of the most iconic operators and entrepreneurs in the space (e.g. Sweetgreen, Headspace, One Medical, Thrive Market).Started by the former CEO & Founder of Greatist (acquired by Healthline in 2019), were building an AmEx-like credit card for health. We’ve got enormous ambitions to flip healthcare on its head through an alternative to health insurance that rewards consumers for the right behaviors and brings down the cost of healthcare.What Impact You Can MakeAs a product designer on our Design team, you’ll be crafting a revolutionary health and finance experience that has the potential to change healthcare forever.In this role, you’ll drive discovery, research, ideation, and design of the product, as well as partner with engineering and product management to ship new experiences.This role sits within the Design team, under the Experience pillar.You May Be The Ideal Candidate If YouIf you don’t meet 100% of the below qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying. We take a holistic approach to evaluating talent for our team. Have 4-5 years of experience in product design, with work thats made its way into consumer-facing software (ideally, iOS). Have a design portfolio that showcases your eye for good visual design and attention to detail. Are a systems-thinker and can see beyond the pixels. Are highly collaborative in a remote-first environment and enjoy sharing work early and often. Are able to manage your work autonomously and comfortable with the pace that comes with an early-stage startup. Are a wizard in Figma (bonus points for motion design). Are a self-starter—there’s always something you want to do, learn, and grow in as a designer. Have a bachelor’s degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product), Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. Things You Might Do Design and shape the product experience into something truly magical. Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to identify new opportunities and envision creative solutions. Act as the champion for the user experience, clearly articulating design rationale internally and externally. Evolve our design process and standards such that it inspires and influences the work of others across the company. Support the team in constant experimentation through data and user feedback to improve the user experience and product. Empower engineers to get the fit and finish right. Our Core ValuesWe arent a family, were an incredible team. At Ness, our core values are the source of our POWER.✏️ Pencil It InWe move fast, try new things fearlessly, think differently, and learn from our mistakes.🙏🏼 One NessWere all on the same team, have short memories, plus can disagree and commit.🥓 Work CrispyWe value clear, rigorous thought, give regular feedback, and were always prepared.🦕 Embrace Your Mythical CreatureOur differences make us special. Come as you are (but no trolls, please!)👏🏽 Right Way To Win (Not The Easy Way)We believe in doing well AND doing good.How We HireFirst, we dont discriminate. We know from experience that a more diverse and inclusive team leads to bigger impact and success.1. First HelloYoull talk to our CXO & Co-Founder, Kenneth for 15-30 minutes. Theres nothing to prepare in advance.First, we want to figure out if youve got the right experience for this position and if working at Ness is a fit for you and us. Well have reviewed your portfolio in detail, so this discussion will be mostly a behavioral interview focused on what youve done before. We want to build conviction that youll succeed in this job the same way youve succeeded in the past.Then, youll have time to ask us anything! (Well, mostly anything.)2. The Jam SeshAfter this, well schedule a design jam with Kenneth and potentially other Ness team members. Why? We believe collaboration is a key skill for designers in a remote-first company—and we want a chance to see you in action. Well share more details about this when we get there!3. Portfolio ReviewNext, you’ll have a chance to share 2-3 of your past projects and go deep on them. Here, we’re trying to understand your approach to design projects and see your craft in detail. We also want to learn how you frame the problem, how you articulate your process and decisions, and what explorations you considered prior to arriving at the final solution.4. Meet the TeamYoull meet other team members via a series of 30-60 minute 1:1’s including our CEO & Founder, Derek. Here, we want to explore if were a good fit for each other. We also want to learn what brings out the best in you and whats next. We want to be confident Ness can offer the environment (culture, responsibility, org structure, etc.) thats led you to the most professional success so far.Youll have time to ask questions, too!5. ReferencesOh—and, with your help, well reach out to folks youve worked with in the past. Were usually pretty far along here, so this is mostly about learning from outside perspectives about how to manage and empower you best.6. The Job OfferGot this far? That means youre in. Expect a personal call from Kenneth or Derek and welcome to the team!No recruiters or agencies, please. Thanks!

title: Senior Product Designer
description: We are only accepting people located in Australia or New Zealand or willing to work at least 4 cross over hours with Sydney, AustraliaOur MissionIt is our mission to empower investors to make informed decisions, just like Warren Buffet. We help the everyday investor by providing complex financial data in a simplified format at an affordable price. Previously, this level of data was out of reach from both the price perspective and investing literacy ability.Why Join?- Global, B2C SaaS startup;- We have +5 million users, across 170 countries;- Small team and flexible environment making it easy to rapidly iterate;- Work with a product customers love: 4.5* Trustpilot Reviews.- Join a diverse team of people from Atlassian, The Iconic, Deputy, eBay, Ansarada, Airtasker & more!The business problem we are solving? We are in search of a designer who has a strong passion for investing and can assist us in speeding up our product discovery process.The objective of the role and how you will make an impactOur goal is to enhance the customer experience on Simply Wall St by providing a seamless journey across all digital touch-points, both on the web and mobile. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to solve original design problems for retail investors and take ownership of your solutions from discovery to delivery. The role will be a mix of both UX (30%) and UI (70%). We encourage collaboration and value your input in identifying product opportunities and finding solutions.Key projects/interesting challenges you will work onOur teams are responsible for solving various customer problems. As a member of our team, you will tackle complex investing challenges and contribute to important projects such as: Participating in user research alongside product managers to refine design decisions and product directions, Enhancing portfolio protection and growth for investors, Improving the stock analysis experience for investors through custom visualisations and interactions, Expanding growth channels to reach more customers and provide value faster, Collaborating on a design system and component library.What is unique about this role?You will get the opportunity to work in a small team where you can focus on creating timeless designs directly to consumers. It’s important for our designers to fully understand the data and analysis behind the design and how that helps users accomplish what they want to achieve or learn. We iterate through qualitative research sessions.Current team structure and how the team work together?We currently have 50 employees in Simply Wall St, most are based in APAC, with 4 product teams and 2 designers. You will join a small cross-functional team with a focus on one pillar of our product. We work in an agile environment and follow OKRs as our goal-setting and alignment framework.What is important to us for hiring for this role? We are looking for an individual with exceptional visual and interface design abilities, who has a passion for data visualisation. Someone who is enthusiastic about the stock market and has invested, as a recent first-time investor or has been investing for a few years. Additionally, you should possess excellent product sense, enjoy exploring design options to uncover groundbreaking ideas and be attuned to small details that could have a significant impact.What kind of career growth does SWS offer? You will have the opportunity to work alongside a team of committed engineers and product managers to deliver true customer-centric software. This entails steering the course of projects over various release cycles, shaping their long-term direction and grow with your teams.What we are looking for?- Interest in Investing: We are seeking someone who shares our passion for our mission and vision. - Product Software Experience: Previous experience in successfully discovering and delivering new product initiatives for a software product. - Customer Focus: You should be customer-obsessed and prioritise understanding and empathising with users problems. - Experimentation: A willingness to experiment is important, as not all ideas will be perfect until they are tested. - Insights Focused: Our platform contains a wealth of data, and we hope you are eager to help simplify how this information is communicated to our customers.PerksAt Simply Wall St, we know that everyone is unique. Everyone has their own personal style of work, different productive hours, values flexibility, and enjoys the autonomy of their schedule to manage their workdays according to their own respective needs and wants. We want you to work where and when you’re most effective. Maybe you’re an early bird, or a night owl. Maybe you prefer the office, or working from a van.To support you both professionally and personally, we believe flexibility is fundamental to our ways of working.Work from Anywhere: Opportunity to work overseas for 3 months;Bueller (personal) days: 4 extra paid days off per year;Simply Stop Afternoons: We stop working every Friday at 2.30pm;Competitive Salaries & ESOP: We are a startup but we don’t underpay. Everyone owns our success;Parental Leave & Compassionate Leave: Extra support offered, with part-time return to work option;Learning & Development Fund: Development fund to invest in your growth;Share Club: We provide subscription to SWS, cash for you to invest & regular sessions to discuss stocks and investment ideas;Team Events & Quarterly Hackathons: An opportunity for everyone to come together and push what is possible;Curious about life at SWS & how we operate? Click this link https://simplywallst.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SWSP/overview

title: Visual Designer
description: The RoleAs a visual designer at Alchemy, youll get to help define how the world views our brand and build. Youll work cross-functionally to build Alchemys global visual identity across our international user base with a focus on the future. Every piece of work you ship will be viewed by millions across major news outlets such as Bloomberg, New York Times, Wired, and the largest blockchain media outlets.Responsibilities Deliver delightful digital assets to all functions of the company, including leadership, marketing, communications, and engineering Lead the creative process from conception to creation across a wide breadth of use cases Help evolve the Alchemy brand Work on important investor presentations/decks, landing pages, and graphic compositions for blogs, newsletters, and more marketing efforts Iterate on design based on feedback from the greater team Maintain a high-quality threshold with regards to the Alchemy brand What Were Looking For 5+ years of experience as a visual designer, within a digital agency/studio or in-house, tech-related Inclusive of proven ability to design and deliver high-quality brand, marketing collateral Ability to ideate, conceptualize and sketch your design proposals Ability to take your concepts through to final production-ready Design-driven, but a strategy-led approach to executing visuals concepts Exceptional eye for design with a good pulse on current trends and best practices Thrive on multitasking on a wide range of subjects and projects You understand how to work to tight deadlines, over multiple projects, engage with multiple teams and deliver quality throughout everything you design. You take immense pride in your work and you strive to improve continuously over every project you work on. Proficient in Figma, Adobe CC suite (PS, AI & AE), Webflow (not essential but beneficial) You are passionate about shape, color, typography and have demonstrable knowledge of how to apply this. Passion for blockchain technologies is a plus Required: Work should be reflected in an amazing portfolio

title: Senior Python Backend Developer with Blockchain Experience
description: Job Title Senior Python Backend Developer with Blockchain Experience Job Description How your work with us will look like? You will be developing new features, supporting more exchanges, more blockchains, and more DeFi protocols. There is also always a lot of troubleshooting of user reported issues, bugs, and feature requests that are coming our way. You can improve our current Python backend implementation and help us get Rotki to the next level! As an open source project, we work collaboratively on our codebase on GitHub in a style that should be familiar to anyone who has participated in an OSS community before. If you haven’t — we’re happy to support you in defining and writing great feature descriptions, and breaking them down into dev tasks, and shipping them to customers around the world. This is an early stage open source company, so there is an opportunity to take on a variety of tasks beyond the app, such as the backend of the website, and our API. What we offer: A full-time position, but are open to part-time contributors as well. If located in Germany we can provide full employment with insurance and social benefits. Flexible working hours. We sync once per day, but other than that you decide when you work. Remote / WFH Training in the specifics of the project and guidance through the sector of cryptocurrencies and decentralized finance Participation in conferences and events to represent rotki and get to know other fascinating projects from the field (travel expenses are on us) Restrictions Telecommuting is OK No Agencies Please Requirements Requirements: Excellent command of python. Experience with distributed systems: we connect to API endpoints and nodes for various blockchains. Understanding of Ethereum blockchain structures, nodes, and API endpoints Experience with any other blockchain stack — e.g. Cosmos, Substrate, etc. Bonus points: Write tests for features you code and bugs you fix. Not strict TDD, but we’re always looking to increase test coverage Understanding of the frontend tech used in Rotki: Typescript + vue.js + electron. This role doesnt require you to be a front end expert, but understanding of these technologies will help you. Sharing our values on open source, data ownership and privacy Non-technical bonus points: 4 hours daily overlap with European working hours 0900 CET - 1700 CET for smoother teamwork Can work independently, but co-operates well with other team members. Proactive and customer-oriented About the Company What is rotki? Rotki helps manage accounts and blockchain transactions. It’s local-first, privacy focused and all open source. We are long time contributors to the Ethereum ecosystem and general crypto space. In order to support more blockchains (Cosmos, Roll Ups, etc.), and to continue to ship new features we need the help of a backend Python developer. Contact Info Contact: Celina E-mail contact: careers@rotki.com Web: https://rotki.com/jobs

title: Lead Developer Python / Linux (m/f/x) remote
description: Job Title Lead Developer Python / Linux (m/f/x) remote Job Description Continuous development of UCS Elaboration and implementation of architectural changes Advising other development teams on their implementations Product management and Product Owner define the functional contents for a release, and you provide the necessary technical part of the release scope You commit with your team to the implementation of prioritized topics for a quarter. During the quarter, you work self-organized towards achieving your goals Expansion of our automated testing and software development infrastructure (CI/CD) Restrictions Telecommuting is OK No Agencies Please Requirements Minimum of 6 years of experience in open source development projects with Python in Linux environments You have already taken on responsibilities in various ways, whether as a trainer, lead developer, or team lead You are familiar with the concepts of agile software development Experience in the area of REST API, network communication, security, Docker, and message queuing are helpful Practical knowledge of standards in test automation and CI/CD (Git, GitLab) Fluent English skills Permanent residence in Europe About the Company Univention GmbH is developing open-source software for the management of digital identities and the integration of IT applications. Openness, scalability, and the simple use of IT are just as important as digital sovereignty and control over one’s own data and processes. Univention Corporate Server (UCS) is an integration platform offering identity management, comprehensive Active Directory functions, an App Center for integrating enterprise applications, and a user portal for accessing IT services. Contact Info Contact: Konstance Weber-Kast E-mail contact: jobs@univention.de Web: https://www.univention.com/about-us/careers/vacancies/senior-backend-software-developer-python-mfx/

title: Senior Software Engineer - Fullstack
description: Job Title Senior Software Engineer - Fullstack Job Description We are hiring a Senior Software Engineer to join our development team! Initially, you will work alongside our Tech Lead on a refactoring project with the goal of modernizing our base architecture. More details on that below, but first an introduction to us Who we’re looking for Initially, this role will be part of a long-term refactoring project alongside our Tech Lead. After this refactoring project, the role will transition to one that involves new feature development, bug fixes, writing tests, and assisting with code reviews. We are looking for someone who: Has proven full-stack experience in Django, Python, FastAPI, and React/React-Saga Has previous experience refactoring existing code and designing new API interfaces Has a solid conceptual understanding of server architecture & scalable systems Is able to identify limitations of existing code and thoughtfully plan out its integration into the new architecture, including testing assumptions beforehand and thoroughly testing post-integration Can identify technical risks, performance bottlenecks, and scaling opportunities Can identify opportunities to improve our development processes to ensure all code follows - standards, is well tested, and goes to production with minimal risk of incidents Restrictions Telecommuting is OK No Agencies Please Requirements In terms of industry work experience, the following is relevant for this role: 5+ years of industry software development experience 2+ years in a software development role for a SaaS business Previous experience with FastAPI (or a willingness to learn) Previous experience in Redis, MongoDB, and/or Elasticsearch An understanding of Linux-based operating systems About the Company Who we are We’re a profitable, bootstrapped company that helps health & wellness clinics reduce paperwork, stay organized, and ultimately free up their time so they can spend more time with clients and less time managing administrative tasks. Officially, we’re based in Toronto, Canada but each of us works remotely across North America, Europe, and Africa. We are looking for someone who is comfortable with a 4 to 5 hours overlap with the EST timezone. We use Slack to stay in touch throughout the week and Google Meet for sprint planning, standups, and a once-per-week full team meeting (for a demo day, updates from customer support/marketing/customer success, and we have a bit of fun playing a game together). Our tech stack: Django, FastAPI React, Redux and Redux-Saga MySQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Redis AWS GitLab Why join us We’re a team that loves what we do and we all thrive on our ability to make an impact. We measure our success based on our output and quality of work, not the number of hours worked each week. We value work-life balance and offer flexibility to handle anything that may come up in our personal lives and to work when we feel the most productive. Compensation Salary - competitive based on experience & location Vacation - 26 vacation days (15 days PTO + 11 public holidays) ClinicSense asks respectfully to only apply through the application form and not email/apply to them directly. Recruiters and Agencies please do not contact ClinicSense directly. Contact Info Contact: Dynamite Jobs E-mail contact: jack@dynamitejobs.com Web: https://dynamitejobs.com/company/clinicsense/remote-job/senior-software-engineer-fullstack
location: Remote Europe Latin America CA United States MX

title: Python Data Engineer (F/T - Direct-hire only)
description: Job Title Python Data Engineer (F/T - Direct-hire only) Job Description Use Python and other object oriented scripting languages to: Create, maintain and orchestrate optimal data pipeline architecture Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. Improve and streamline data systems to drive innovation within Prizepicks Our Analytics Team is responsible for building and maintaining analytics tools and workflows to support the PrizePicks business. By developing, maintaining, and testing data generation infrastructures, you will enable the PrizePicks business to make smarter, better, and faster data-driven decisions. Restrictions Telecommuting is OK No Agencies Please Requirements USA resident candidate only Experience with Python and other object oriented scripting languages 3+ years of experience building frameworks for data ingestion pipelines but real time and batch using data modeling, ETL/ELT processes Stellar SQL skills, experience building DBT pipelines in production and know your way around structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. Have built and optimized ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Cloud experience: AWS, EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift, GCP, etc.. Not required but would be awesome if you have experience with any of the following data pipeline and workflow tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Prefect, etc. About the Company At PrizePicks, we are the fastest growing sports company in North America, as recognized by Inc. 5000. As the leading platform for Daily Fantasy Sports, we cover a diverse range of sports leagues, including the NFL, NBA, and Esports titles like League of Legends and CS : GO. Our team of over 200 employees thrives in an inclusive culture that values individuals from diverse backgrounds, regardless of their level of sports fandom. Ready to reimagine the DFS industry together? Contact Info E-mail contact: carlos.hung@prizepicks.com Web: https://grnh.se/9983a3793us

title: Data Scientist - Sports Modeling (F/T - Direct-hire only)
description: Job Title Data Scientist - Sports Modeling (F/T - Direct-hire only) Job Description Work closely with other data scientists, reporting analysts, and cross departmental directors to test business flows, make business recommendations, and provide novel business insights to leadership focused on driving revenue growth, optimizing marketing efficiency and optimizing retention efforts. Data cleaning operations, wrangling and visualizations. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. Experience working with relational databases such as PostgreSQL. Data visualization and report building experience is a plus. Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills. title: Python Developer
description: Job Title Python Developer Job Description Currently, we have multiple projects and in these you could work on Implementing new features Collaborate with colleagues and share your expertise to help them Help address and fix problems regarding our software and infrastructure Ensure data quality and code quality is maintained Build reusable code and libraries for future use Contribute to planning and technical specifications Were a remote friendly-team, and members of our team are working from Budapest, Bognor Regis and London. We dont expect you to be located anywhere in particular, but we would like your working day to overlap Londons for at least five hours a day. Restrictions Telecommuting is OK Agencies are OK Requirements Minimum 5+ years of experience as a Python developer or in a similar role with experience in one or more: API development, web scraping, developing data pipelines Minimum 2+ years experience with AWS or Heroku or equivalent cloud provider Problem solving and troubleshooting skills Docker PostgreSQL/MongoDB GitHub, CircleCI Great English communication skills AWS DevOps skills such as codebuild, codedeploy, ECS, CloudFormation Experience with Scrum (Nice to have) Working experience with ElasticSearch/AWS OpenSearch (Nice to have) Experience and interest in ML, generative AI and NLP fields (Nice to have) Unix scripting knowledge (Nice to have) University degree (Nice to have) About the Company Spend Network (https://spendnetwork.com) is a data analysis company dedicated to gathering and analysing public contracting data. We’re a small, friendly team that cares about being inclusive and doing good work. We’re open to remote working and flexible working. We sell our data to businesses and Governments, but also make the data available for free to academics, journalists and activists. Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment that encourages creativity, growth, and excellence within the team. Prioritize problems and innovate solutions. Lead by example, exhibiting strong technical expertise (front-end and back-end), and demonstrating a passion for software engineering and cybersecurity.
